session_focus: Migrated parser from 'agent' to 'worker' keyword and replaced 'fail' with 'throw' as unary operator
completed_work: Changed 'agent' keyword to 'worker' throughout lexer, parser, AST, and tests
Changed 'fail' statement to 'throw' unary prefix operator
Updated parser grammar: AgentDecl→WorkerDecl, removed FailStmt, added throw to UnaryExpr
Updated AST: Item::Worker, WorkerDecl struct, UnOp::Throw enum variant
Updated adapter.rs and ast_dump.rs for new tokens
Fixed test collision where 'worker' was used as identifier
key_decisions: Worker keyword indicates second-class agents (not general-purpose)
Throw as unary operator allows throwing arbitrary expressions (like JavaScript)
More expressive than statement-based fail: throw 'error message', throw {code: 500}
Maintained 'Agent' as valid type name for trait inheritance
files_modified: crates/patchwork-parser/src/patchwork.lalrpop - Grammar rules for worker and throw
examples/historian/analyst.pw - Bug fix for parameter reference
current_state: All changes complete and tested - ready to commit
